response:
reasoning='1. Required horizontal distance is 4000 m with a dive to 400 m depth midway, so each leg must cover ≥2000 m horizontally.  
2. Choosing a constant glide angle θ of 10° (tan θ≈0.1763) gives a horizontal distance per leg h = 400 m / tan θ ≈ 2268 m. Total horizontal travel = 4536 m > 4000 m, satisfying the range requirement.  
3. Path length per leg s = 400 m / sin θ ≈ 2304 m; total path length ≈ 4608 m. At the prescribed glide speed 1 m s⁻¹, total mission time = 4608 s ≈ 1.28 h < 2 h.  
4. Select vehicle volume V = 0.30 m³ (within 0.2–1 m³). To keep density ≤ρ_water (1025 kg m⁻³) pick total mass m = 250 kg, giving density 250 kg / 0.30 m³ = 833 kg m⁻³ ≤ 1025 kg m⁻³, so the vehicle can float without ballast water.  
5. Power profile: P(z) = 100 W + 0.05 m + 0.2 z = (100 + 0.05·250) + 0.2 z = 112.5 W + 0.2 z.  
6. Energy per leg: E = (1/v)∫[112.5 + 0.2 z(s)]ds with z = s sin θ, v = 1 m s⁻¹. This yields E_leg = 112.5 s + 0.1 sin θ s², where s = 2304 m and sin θ = 0.1736.  
   • Constant term: 112.5 W × 2304 s = 259 680 J.  
   • Depth-dependent term: 0.1·0.1736·(2304 m)² ≈ 92 192 J.  
   • E_leg ≈ 351 872 J.  
7. Total mission energy (two legs): E_tot ≈ 703 744 J = 703 744 J / 3600 J Wh⁻¹ ≈ 195.5 Wh.  
8. This is below the 200 Wh battery cap, satisfying the energy constraint.  
9. All mission and design constraints are met with θ = 10°, V = 0.30 m³, m = 250 kg.' config=ConfigFile(angle=10.0, volume=0.3, mass=250.0)
